alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 2:04PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Weld and central Adams Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 204 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from near Hudson to 9 miles northeast of D.I.A Terminal and Concourses to far eastern Aurora, or along a line extending from 26 miles south of Greeley to 44 miles southwest of Fort Morgan to 21 miles east of Denver. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 40 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Aurora, Hudson, Bennett, Keenesburg, Manila Village, Prospect Valley and Strasburg. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County
